title: I just wanted to put this somewhere
body:
Hi I'm Married to Nami, 

I used to be a regular on the GD forums, not really posting much but reading and getting into the spirit of things here and there. I have gone by many names during my time on OCE  servers and many know me by 'Caress of Venus' (the name I used when I was most active).

Its not a hidden fact for the last 3 seasons I was a bronze scrub, and I can say -now- that I've finally gotten off Bronze's wild ride. 
This morning I finished my promotion into Silver 5. It's not much, but its a start. 

I love this game, specifically Nami and Kindred -but whatever- and for a long time I just felt like the stigma of being bronze was getting me down. There were so many jokes about how terrible being a bronze player was. I looked at hundreds of videos on how the prop players and so on had climbed through the tiers to their rightful place but it always felt a little alienating to me, I was a player who doesn't follow the meta, which is probably why I've spent such a long time in Bronze. 

So I guess what I'm trying to say is, that the relief of finally meeting the expectations of those who had supported me while I was in bronze, saying really encouraging things like: "your supporting is definitely not Bronze Level," or "wow [Champion] how are you bronze" really encouraged me to do my best to prove that I could break free of the chains that bronze has so tightly wrapped around me.

A lot of the old GDers spent a good deal of time playing games with me, giving me tips (and me being an ass to them telling me I was wrong, sorry) and generally encouraging me, and I'm really thankful for it.

So this post is really just a thank you to them, because preseason 2016 has been the ideal time for me to be playing ranked. The meta suits the way I love to play, and I've managed to pull a lot of my wins on two of my old favourite champions - Miss Fortune and Sona -

Sorry about this boring as post, I just needed to get this off my chest I guess. Thanks everyone!

{{champion:267}}
